name: David SCHILLER, Esquire, Receiver of Thomas E. Angst & Associates, P.C. v. ROYAL MACCABEES LIFE INSURANCE COMPANY and Federal Kemper Life Assurance Company and Robert E. Angst. Petition of Royal Maccabees Life Insurance Company
name_abbreviation: Schiller v. Royal Maccabees Life Insurance
docket_number: Petition No. 1227 Middle District Allocatur Docket 1999

parties: David SCHILLER, Esquire, Receiver of Thomas E. Angst & Associates, P.C. v. ROYAL MACCABEES LIFE INSURANCE COMPANY and Federal Kemper Life Assurance Company and Robert E. Angst. Petition of Royal Maccabees Life Insurance Company.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
AND NOW, this 28th day of April, 2000, the Petition for Allowance of Appeal is GRANTED. The Order of the Superi- or Court is REVERSED. The docket does not reflect that the Prothonotary of the Court of Common Pleas of Montgomery County sent notice of the October 23, 1997 order to the parties in compliance with Pa.R.C.P. 236. Thus, the order of October 23, 1997 was not final. Frazier v. City of Philadelphia, 557 Pa. 618, 735 A.2d 113 (1999). This matter is REMANDED to the Superior Court to address the merits of the appeal.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Eugene Hamill, Anne E. Walters, Philadelphia, for petitioner.
casebody.head_matter:
748 A.2d 1234
David SCHILLER, Esquire, Receiver of Thomas E. Angst & Associates, P.C. v. ROYAL MACCABEES LIFE INSURANCE COMPANY and Federal Kemper Life Assurance Company and Robert E. Angst. Petition of Royal Maccabees Life Insurance Company.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
April 28, 2000.
Eugene Hamill, Anne E. Walters, Philadelphia, for petitioner.
